game_description: Linelight is a relaxing, wholesome puzzle game with a big heart. Picture getting a back massage while grooving to chill electronic beats, solving clever, award-winning puzzles, always ready to discover what surprises wait around the corner. PLAY LAYING DOWN Finally, a VR game you can play horizontally! You can optionally play laying down comfortably with the game above you. This is about as relaxing as technology gets. YA GONNA FEEL SMART You are going to feel smart. YOU CAN DO EET The only control is to move. So whether this is your first game or your thousandth, you can pick it up in just a few seconds. MUCH CONTENT There are over 6 worlds chock-filled with ingenious puzzles and surprises, with a total of 6-8 hours of delightful content. QUOTES “Finding a game like Linelight feels like a blessing.” - GameSpot “Bursting with design smarts… For a chilled puzzling time, they don’t get much better than this.” - Rock Paper Shotgun “Pure, unadulterated gameplay.” - Polygon “Linelight is nothing short of a stroke of genius.” - Hardcore Gamer “A crowning achievement in the puzzle genre… An unforgettably unique gaming experience.” - OPNoobs (9/10) “Ingenious… The amount of times I said to myself ‘Ooh, that’s clever!’ was too numerous to count.” - God is a Geek (9/10)
Languages: English, French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Russian, Spanish (Mexico)
review_1: I just wish there was an angle to play between straight-up and directly forward. Maybe a slider to select the angle. That would be nice. Otherwise, it's nice to just sit down and feel like a genius as you solve some of the most visually satisfying puzzles ever.
review_2: The game is well-designed, but should allow access to all six levels. I was stuck on level 3 and consulted the developer and YouTube to figure out how to pass it. This was very helpful and I was able to get pass the level. Puzzle games stimulate critical and creative thinking skills.

review_5: First off I like the gameplay. At times it is nice to just relax, the music is nice, and do some thinking without too much going on. Played it for half a hour and don't really see myself returning to it much in the future. The puzzles are good and get you thinking at times, but it kind of gets boring although new things are introduced into the gameplay. But from my standpoint it would be better suited as a flat game(I know it has been for a few years) rather then VR, which brings nothing in VR that is worth talking about. Just don't see the point of wearing a headset to play this for any length of time. Flat then I would play it more as a quick time filler.
